definition[0]: when someone has their property or money officially taken away because they have broken a law or rule
example[0]: Refusal to sign meant forfeiture of property and exile.
definition[1]: when someone loses property or the legal right to have something because they have broken the law
example[1]: Under racketeering law, prosecutors are seeking forfeiture of certain properties.
definition[2]: when someone loses rights, benefits etc
example[2]: Employees should be able to move from one organization to another without worrying about forfeiture of pension benefits.
